text:
Hi all,

I have a question about the relationship between themes and micro sites. We use a number of domains to support our micro sites (<http://hppi.com|hppi.com>, <http://careers.hppi.com|careers.hppi.com>, <http://supplier.hppi.com|supplier.hppi.com> - you get the idea) and I want to edit what I believe are theme-wide settings, such as system pages, headers, footers, header navigation, etc. My first thought was that each micro-site needs its own child theme, but I'm not able to associate the appropriate child theme to its micro-site, and when I look at Branding in Account Defaults, it's showing me that we can only have one theme.

Any ideas or suggestions on how to resolve this issue?? Thanks!

The theme under Branding kit doesn't really matter. I think it just set the default, but you can change it.

I'd just used multiple child themes . I've done it before and it works just fine.

Thanks, Bradley! Did you have to edit anything in the Design Manager to make your micro-site use the appropriate child theme? For example, I want our suppliers portal to use a supplier-specific child theme, but it keeps defaulting to the main one; basically can't get the 2 domains to use separate child themes
There is a Default module that you can use for that.
